info: A number determining how large cities are.  0 disables cities, roads and any scenario requiring a city start.
name: CITY_SIZE

info: Only spawn classic zombies and natural wildlife.  Requires a reset of save folder to take effect.  This disables certain buildings.
name: CLASSIC_ZOMBIES

info: If true, static NPCs will spawn at pre-defined locations. Requires world reset.
name: STATIC_NPC

info: ( WIP feature ) Determines terrain, shops, plants, and more.
name: DEFAULT_REGION

info: Season length, in days.  Warning: Very little other than the duration of seasons scales with this value, so adjusting it may cause nonsensical results.
name: SEASON_LENGTH

info: Season the player starts in.  Options other than the default delay spawn of the character, so food decay and monster spawns will have advanced.
default: Default: spring - Values: spring, summer, autumn, winter
name: INITIAL_SEASON

info: A scaling factor that determines density of monster spawns.
name: SPAWN_DENSITY

info: Sets the time of construction in percents.  '50' is two times faster than default, '200' is two times longer.  '0' automatically scales construction time to match the world's season length.
name: CONSTRUCTION_SCALING

info: Keep the initial season for ever.
name: ETERNAL_SEASON

info: Emulation of zombie hordes.  Zombie spawn points wander around cities and may go to noise.  Must reset world directory after changing for it to take effect.
name: WANDER_SPAWNS

info: Initial starting time of day on character generation.
name: INITIAL_TIME

info: If true, the game will randomly spawn NPCs during gameplay.
name: RANDOM_NPC

info: If true, downstairs will be placed directly above upstairs, even if this results in uglier maps.
name: ALIGN_STAIRS

info: A scaling factor that determines the time between monster upgrades.  A higher number means slower evolution.  Set to 0.00 to turn off monster upgrades.
name: MONSTER_UPGRADE_FACTOR

info: If true, radiation causes the player to mutate.
name: RAD_MUTATION

info: Determines whether starting NPCs should spawn, and if they do, how exactly.
default: Default: scenario - Values: never, always, scenario
name: STARTING_NPC

info: If true, spawn zombies at shelters.  Makes the starting game a lot harder.
name: BLACK_ROAD

info: If true, experimental z-level maps will be enabled.  This feature is not finished yet and turning it on will only slow the game down.
name: ZLEVELS

info: Determines how much damage monsters can take.  A higher value makes monsters more resilient and a lower makes them more flimsy.
name: MONSTER_RESILIENCE

info: Allowed point pools for character generation.
default: Default: any - Values: any, multi_pool, no_freeform
name: CHARACTER_POINT_POOLS

info: Controls what migrations are applied for legacy worlds
name: CORE_VERSION

info: Determines the movement rate of monsters.  A higher value increases monster speed and a lower reduces it.
name: MONSTER_SPEED

info: A scaling factor that determines how often creatures spawn from rotting material.
name: CARRION_SPAWNRATE

info: A scaling factor that determines density of item spawns.
name: ITEM_SPAWNRATE

info: Handling of game world when last character dies.
default: Default: keep - Values: keep, reset, delete, query
name: WORLD_END

info: A scaling factor that determines density of dynamic NPC spawns.
name: NPC_DENSITY

info: A number determining how far apart cities are.  Warning, small numbers lead to very slow mapgen.
name: CITY_SPACING
